definition: Warning signs that treaty obligations expand beyond mandate without consent.

positive_examples: Secretariat issues directives not grounded in treaty text.
Working groups claim authority over unrelated domains.
Joint assets are repurposed without vote.
New enforcement powers appear in guidance memos.
Treaty references show up in contracts never approved.
Observers note language drift in communiqués.
Sanctions are applied for behaviors outside scope.
Scope questions are dismissed as obstruction.
Change control for scope is undefined.
Implementation teams cite treaty to enforce local priorities.
Scope diagrams are replaced with ambiguous prose.
Side groups create their own annexes unilaterally.
negative_examples: Secretariat actions cite specific treaty clauses.
Working groups stay within chartered areas.
Asset usage changes go through approvals.
Treaty references in contracts are reviewed.
Scope questions are welcomed and answered.
training_hints.disambiguation: Warning signs that treaty obligations expand beyond mandate without consent.
